PARAGRAPH.STRING: is a fourteen thousand foot mountain in the US state of Colorado.
is the 47th highest mountain peak in Colorado, and 78th highest peak in the United States.

is located in the Elk Mountains in southeastern Pitkin County, approximately 12 miles (19 km) southwest of Aspen. The summit somewhat resembles a ragged square pyramid and is visible from the Roaring Fork River valley north of Aspen along the canyon of Maroon Creek.
Like many of the peaks in the Elks,
is quite steep, especially compared to more gentle fourteeners such as Mount Elbert. For example,
summit rises 4,000 ft (1,220 m) above Crater Lake to the northwest in only 1.2 mi (1.9 km), and 4,400 ft (1,340 m) above East Maroon Creek to the east of
